title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 29 September 2017 - BBC News
summary: man arrested by police investigating suspected hit-and-run in dartmouth .
number of people killed on roads in devon and cornwall rises sharply .
victory for deportation earnings row woman .
plymouth tungsten mining company makes £ 43.6m loss .
sharp rise in number of parents requesting extra help for children in schools .
scientists , including a university of exeter professor , work on making computing chips that use light .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon and cornwall for this week , but we 'll be back - bright-eyed and bushy-tailed - at 08:00 on monday to bring you all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't miss spotlight tonight at 18:30 on bbc one with justin leigh and janine jansen and the late news with janine at 22:30 .
have a good weekend .

documents.title: weather : a cooler night before bright spells and rain on saturday
text: we will see a cooler night than of late , with showers , a few heavy , feeding in from the south west .
there will be some blustery winds along exposed coasts too , but inland the winds will gradually ease .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
saturday will see a mix of brighter spells and scattered showers at first .
however , the skies will turn increasingly cloudy through the day with more persistent rain arriving for the afternoon and evening .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: judge slams jeremy kyle show in incest case
text: a judge has been critical of the jeremy kyle show after hearing how a defendant in an incest case appeared on the programme to deny knowing who her father was .
katie buscombe ( right ) , 25 , appeared on the show in february 2016 .
she was sentenced today at truro crown court , along with her uncle , 57-year-old philip buscombe ( left ) , after both admitted the charge of having sex with an adult relative , namely each other .
judge robert linford said : `` why the makers of a tv programme think there is money to be made from people such as you is entirely beyond me . ''
the court heard mr buscombe 's brother is the biological father of mrs buscombe .
the incest happened while they were living together in bugle , cornwall , between august 2012 and august 2013 , the court heard .
the judge told them : `` you both knew it was wrong but nevertheless you did it '' .
katie buscombe , who is now married to another man , was given a 12-month supervision order .
mr buscombe , a tractor driver from cornwall , was also given a 12-month supervision order , and ordered to do 100 hours of unpaid community work .

documents.title: goal posts widened for educational needs support
text: a steep rise in the number of requests for special educational needs assessments has been driven by a change in the rules , according to the leader of devon county council .
in the past year , the number in devon has increased by 99 % , while cornwall has seen a 61 % rise .
council leader john hart said local authorities were now responsible for a much wider age range .
`` instead of youngsters being the responsibility of the local authority from five to 15 , they 're now from nought to 25 , and that 's given us a wider catchment area , '' he said .
`` they 've also changed the rules so parents have also got the right to ask for their children to be assessed . ''
author: Anna Varle
BBC News Online

documents.title: man challenges decision to stop health monitoring service
text: a seriously ill man from north cornwall has successfully challenged the local nhs to review a decision to stop offering a health monitoring service which he says saved his life .
solicitors acting for ian wyness , from davidstow , argued that service commissioning body nhs kernow 's decision to end the telehealth service was unlawful .
telehealth remotely monitors patients ' vital signs and transmits the information via phone or broadband .
mr wyness said the service was vital in managing his chronic heart condition .
service commissioning body nhs kernow has agreed to continue funding telehealth until the review is complete .
a six-week consultation with patients is under way .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: uncle and niece sentenced for incest
text: an uncle and his niece have been sentenced for having consensual sex with each other .
katie buscombe ( right ) , 25 , and her uncle philip buscombe ( left ) , 57 , both previously pleaded guilty to the charge of having sex with an adult relative .
the offences happened while they were living together in bugle , cornwall , between august 2012 and august 2013 .
both were given community orders at truro crown court .

documents.title: rise in south west road fatalities
text: the number of people killed on devon and cornwall 's roads has risen sharply , according to figures published by the government yesterday .
in the 12 months to june , 54 people died - 10 more than the previous year .
chief inspector adrian leisk , head of roads policing for devon and cornwall police , said 98 % of crashes involved some form of driver error , and that motorists needed to moderate their behaviour .
`` we 've got 22,000km ( 13,700 miles ) of road network to police in devon and cornwall and we ca n't be everywhere , '' he said .
`` what we need is for people to take road deaths seriously . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: deadly portguguese man-of-war washes up at challaborough
text: a deadly portuguese man-of-war has been found washed up at a popular south devon surfing beach .
it 's the first time the creatures whose stings can be fatal have been found at challaborough .
others have been spotted on the nearby river dart , blackpool sands and at several other locations in devon , cornwall and wales .
the nhs recommends using tweezers or a clean stick , and gloves if possible , to remove man-of-war tentacles .
if symptoms become more severe , or a sensitive part of the body has been stung , people should seek medical help .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: manchester denies claims it 'moved people to cornwall '
text: manchester city council says that that if it was going to rehouse people from the city elsewhere in the uk - it `` would choose somewhere cheaper than cornwall '' .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: passengers ' views could shape branchline development
text: passengers who use the maritime line - the railway which links truro , penryn and falmouth - are being encouraged to have their say on the future development of the line .
there 's been a huge increase in the number of people using it over the past few years , with more than 660,000 journeys made last year .
the branch line users are being asked to take part in a survey , the results of which will feed into the work of the maritime line forum , and shape the future of the line .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: gary lineker twitter row over ukip 's new lion
text: ukip and the football pundit , gary lineker , have become embroiled in a war of words over the party 's new logo , which resembles the emblem of football 's premier league .
the design de a lion in the party 's traditional purple on a white background next to the slogan `` ukip .
for the nation '' , prompting a tweet with an eye-rolling emoji from lineker that the premier league `` will be thrilled '' .

ukip , which is holding its annual party conference in torquay , responded with a `` we 're not that stupid '' , with a spokesman describing lineker as a `` very well-known , somewhat sanctimonious , extremely well-paid tv celebrity who has their own opinions '' .
the ping-pong tweets continued , with lineker hitting back with : `` but i 'm working hard on having someone else 's opinions . ''

documents.title: bolton elected ukip leader at party conference in torquay
text: henry bolton has been elected as the new leader of ukip at the party 's annual conference in torquay .
the new leader , and former candidate for kent police and crime commissioner , is the party 's fourth leader in just over a year after a contest that divided the party .
he beat anti-islam campaigner and bookmakers ' favourite anne marie waters
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: age uk centre users get letter saying 'it will close '
text: people who 've been using the age uk centre in truro say they have been receiving letters saying it will close at the end of november .
the centre has been offering help for about 30 years , but has been under threat because of changes in funding from cornwall council and problems with the building .
cornwall council previously said the premises were up a very steep slope , and had limited access and very restricted parking .
the charity has been contacted for comment on the letters and possible closure date .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: groundbreaking work on computer chip technology
text: a professor from the university of exeter is working on computer chips that use light rather than electricity .
photonic chips can also operate in a way that mimics the processes in the human brain , but 1,000 times faster .
professor david wright said the technology was similar to what was already used with fibre optics in communications .
`` moving from electronics to light has already been done what we 're looking at is moving to using similar technology , '' he added .
author: John Ayres
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel update : accident on m5 near exeter
text: there are reports of an accident on the m5 plymouth-bound , between junction 30 exeter services and junction 31 exminster .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: torpoint ferry fault 'traced , isolated and fixed '
text: a mechanical fault which has kept one of the torpoint ferries out of action for the past two days has been dealt with , tamar crossings has tweeted .
the service runs between torpoint and plymouth .
ferry : three ferry service .
we have traced , isolated and fixed the fault that has caused the recent issues with

documents.title: tunes in the dunes festival at perranporth under threat
text: councillors in cornwall have said that aspects of the last tunes in the dunes festival hosted by the watering hole on perranporth beach earlier this summer can not happen again '' .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: saxo car witnesses sought in dartmouth 'hit-and-run ' probe
text: police who have arrested a man over a suspected hit-and-run death have appealed for anyone who saw a silver or metallic blue citroen saxo in dartmouth to get in touch .
officers said they would like to speak to anyone who saw a similar saxo on tuesday night or early on wednesday in the area .
homeless jamie symons , 27 , died after being hit by a car in college way in the town just before 00:40 on wednesday .
sgt gary williamson , of devon and cornwall police , said : `` we are asking the public to contact police urgently with information on a vehicle we are seeking information on . ''
a 20-year-old man from dartmouth has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and is being questioned by police .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: met offices issues severe weather warning
text: a severe weather warning of heavy and persistent rain and strong winds has been issued for sunday and monday , including across the south west .
the met office said conditions could lead to flooding and travel disruption .
a yellow severe weather warning for # rain has been issued : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel update : accident blocks exeter 's king arthur 's road
text: # devon in exeter king arthur 's road is partially blocked , by an accident , a car and cyclist involved near pellinore road .
[ pl ]
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: tiny art gallery hidden in cornish garden
text: a tiny art gallery has been built at glendurgan gardens , near falmouth , in cornwall .
the boat shed gallery is only 1.4m ( 4.5ft ) high and has 12 paintings with the theme of life by the sea .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : mostly bright , with some showers
text: most places will be dry this afternoon with some bright or sunny spells , however , there will also be a scattering of showers .
winds will be mainly moderate or fresh from the southwest , with a maximum temperature of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: investigation into uk 's biggest chicken supplier which has giant devon factory
text: a joint investigation claims that the largest supplier of chicken to uk supermarkets , which owns a major factory in devon , has been tampering with food safety records .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: police guide promotes sexual consent
text: devon and cornwall 's police and crime commissioner 's office is highlighting the force 's good consent guide , which reinforces the message that sex without a `` willing agreement '' is rape .
consent means 'willing agreement ' .
if a person has n't given their consent to sex , it 's rape .
# consentmatters .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: sailing : flying fifteen national championships in falmouth
text: a big international sailing event is under way in falmouth .
the flying fifteens are racing in the national championships .
the name refers to the boats used , which were first designed in the 1940s .
more than 50 crews are taking part .
sailing : falmouth is hosting the national championships of the 'flying fifteens . '
more on @ twitterid at 1735 with @ twitterid
author: Ross Ellis
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: autumnal glory celebrated in weather photos
text: not all the beauty is on the coast in the sw autumn colours , woodland , rivers and big skies all contribute .
# bbcweatherwatchers

documents.title: man held in dartmouth hit-and-run murder probe
text: police carrying out a murder enquiry into the death a man in a suspected hit-and-run incident have arrested a 20-year-old man .
homeless 27-year-old jamie symons died after being hit by a vehicle in college way , dartmouth , early on wednesday .
the man , from dartmouth , was arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and was in custody , devon and cornwall police said .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: stagecoach bus workers vote for strike action
text: stagecoach bus services in the south west could be disrupted next month by industrial action involving more than 800 employees .
bus drivers , cleaners and engineers who are members of the rail , maritime and transport union have voted to take part in three one-day strikes on 13 , 17 and 30 october .
this dispute is over pay and conditions .
rmt general secretary mick cash said : `` bus workers in the south west provide an essential service across a wide geographical area and they deserve a fair deal on pay .
`` at the moment , they are being offered a package that stacks up to a de-facto pay cut and rmt 's executive has agreed with our local branches that that is entirely unacceptable . ''
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: children evacuated from school bus after it catches fire on journey home
text: children near st austell had a hair-raising journey home on thursday afternoon when their school bus caught fire .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: mine bosses 'encouraged ' by tungsten price , despite £ 43.6m loss
text: wolf minerals has reported a £ 43.6m loss after tax at its drakelands mine on the outskirts of plymouth , which opened in 2015 .

the mine at hemerdon has one of the world 's largest tungsten and tin sources , but it has suffered from falling tungsten prices and struggled with problems of reliability and performance at its processing plant .
more than 250 people are employed at the mine .

the company has secured an additional £ 45m of funding and said that , despite the loss , it was `` encouraged by the recent price strength '' of tungsten it and the `` potential for longer term market equilibrium '' .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: traffic light failure in newton abbot
text: # devon in newton abbot on queensway around shaldon road the traffic lights have failed .

documents.title: prime minister questioned over railway resilience
text: prime minister theresa may says the government is still looking carefully at proposals to improve the resilience of the rail network in the south west .
it comes after the labour leader jeremy corbyn said he would fund a £ 2.5bn upgrade if his party was in power .
a major report on the subject was published nearly a year ago .
12 months after all major reports on sw rail resilience submitted , i ask @ twitterid what action the government 's taking .

documents.title: torbay nhs promotes return of stoptober quit smoking scheme
text: smokers in torbay and south devon are being encouraged to take part in the smoking cessation campaign stoptober .
more than a million people have used previous stoptober 's to finally kick the health-endangering habit .
stop smoking for 28 days and you are 5 times more likely to stop for good # stoptober2017 # stoptober
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: green light for housing development on former mod land
text: a former military site which was sold with a guide price of more than £ 750,000 has had plans to build 132 houses on it approved .
cornwall council 's planners gave the green light for penhale camp , near holywell bay , to be demolished and developed for mixed dwelling and commercial use .
the camp , which was built in 1939 and used as a training base for the army , cadets and for outdoor pursuits , was sold by the mod in 2010 .
some local residents had expressed concern that new homes could put a strain on nearby roads , but the planning committee passed the application by 10 votes to two .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon cider bar is the best in the country - it 's official
text: newton abbot 's famous cider bar has been named the best place in the uk to drink real cider less than two years since it was taken over by new landlords .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: tide times for devon and cornwall
text: if you 're thinking about heading to the coast today , here are the times of high water .
there will be a full weather forecast on spotlight 's lunchtime news at 13:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: victory for deportation earnings row woman
text: a south african woman due to be deported has won her battle to stay in devon .

gail freathy , who runs a photographic business with her husband , paul , in torquay , was ordered to leave in january because her visa had expired and the home office ruled they were n't earning enough money to support themselves .
but earlier this week an appeal court judge overturned the government 's ruling under article 8 of the european convention on human rights .
`` it 's fabulous .
but what 's even better is we can carry on with our lives which have been put on hold for 16 months , '' mr freathy said .
the home office said it could n't discuss individual cases .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : rain clearing then mostly dry
text: a band of cloud and rain will clear eastwards to leave a mostly dry and bright morning , while the afternoon will see a mixture of sunny spells and scattered showers with some blustery winds for exposed coasts .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police at primary school gates after child grabbed by man
text: a child escaped after being grabbed from behind by a 6ft tall man in a grey hoodie near a paignton primary school .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: recycling plea from council
text: cornwall council is encouraging people to recycle unwanted items , rather than dumping them .
you can take extra recycling to one of our household recycling centres .
find out where they are :

documents.title: mother waits two years to access autism support for son
text: the number of requests for special educational needs assessments has risen sharply in the past year .
there 's been a 99 % rise in devon and a 61 % increase in cornwall .
one mother in cornwall has waited for two years to access support for her seven-year-old son who 's autistic .
jenny livock said she has had to deal with many late nights , emails and research to get the correct help .
`` it 's the families who fight who manage to get the support , so it 's a really difficult situation to be in , '' she said .
cornwall council said it had a strong record in special educational needs provision , and that it had increased the team which processed the assessments .
author: Anna Varle
BBC South West

documents.title: weather watchers : early sun but brollies needed later !
text: we 'll have a full weather forecast later .
a new day and work to be done .

text: a major search for a man missing in the water in falmouth harbour turned out to be a false alarm .

documents.title: sharp rise in parents wanting help for children in school
text: there 's been a sharp rise in the number of parents requesting extra help for their children in school .
devon has seen a 99 % increase in the number of statutory assessments for special educational needs over the past eight months .
in cornwall , the number of requests has risen by 61 % in the past year .
councils said the demand had gone up since the government changed rules , giving parents the right to ask for help .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good friday morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online
